item.title: Mystical power of Japanese language
item.description:
Here’s an upcoming presentation on Japanese language/culture:


Mystical power of Japanese language 
(Mistyczna moc języka japońskiego)


date: 26.10.2022 (Wednesday)
time: 18:45-20:15
language: English
place: room 112 (H-4)


In this presentation, I will talk about the history of Japanese language, starting from its origins, until the formation of the language that we use today. I will also explain what “language” means to Japanese people, and how their belief affects its everyday usage.

This is an open presentation. Feel free to invite your friends.

Information page: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ne3JSSOBepy-1k7L6XhKWkMUiEyMmD_97--5fpkLzvc/edit?usp=sharing

=============

I am also planning a series of presentations/workshops on
- the concept of "time" in Japanese culture
- Japanese mythology and its possible link to their concept of "time"
- some curious behind-the-scene stories about technological developments in post-war Japan (walkman, quarz watch, QR code, shinkansen, robots, etc.)
These are the details in planning:
03.11.2022 czwartek (TP) 17:05-18:35
17.11.2022 czwartek (TP) 17:05-18:35
01.12.2022 czwartek (TP) 17:05-18:35
15.12.2022 czwartek (TP) 17:05-18:35

There are 4 meetings and they will continue like a lecture series. To get the best understanding, I recommend to follow all of them.

All the workshops/presentations are free, and everyone is welcome. (This is a sort-of trial run, and if it works well this semester, I may change this to a paid course at SJO next semester.)

item.title: A request from SJO
item.description:
I received a message forwarded by SJO, signed by the director. It is a request for Polish students to help a research.

Please remember that 

(1) I do not know this person (Alisa Borkowska) and I do not like the fact that she doesn't have a professional e-mail address;

(2) I cannot guarantee that it is not a phishing mail;

(3) the participation to this questionary is not part of our Japanese course, and it is not obligatory.

I copied below the entire e-mail forwarded by the director of SJO. As you can see, the director doesn't know this person, and there is no credential presented (for example, at which institution or university, she is writing her PhD., etc.). Personally I wouldn't touch this kind of e-mail, BUT I'm obliged by SJO to pass this information to you. If you can ignore all the warning signs of phishing mail and the potential misuse of our contact with students, and if you'd like to help this "research," please feel free to use the link in the e-mail.

==============

Szanowna Pani Magister ( <= referring to the director of SJO)

Chciałabym zwrócić się z prośbą o wsparcie w badaniach naukowych. Mam kontakt do Pani od Pani Profesor Iriny Modrzyckiej, z którą miałam przyjemność rozmawiać się na konferencji. Piszę rozprawę doktorką pod tytułem "Koncepty wartości w językach polskim i ukraińskim oraz ich rola w komunikacji międzykulturowej", w związku z czym przeprowadzam ankietę wśród studentów polskojęzycznych oraz ukraińskojęzycznych. Zależy mi na wynikach zróżnicowanych pod względem terytorialnym, dla tego chce poprosić o rozprzestrzenienie mojej ankiety wśród studentów.

link do ankiety: https://www.survio.com/survey/d/C0S6F8I0P2H9B8S7X  

Bardzo proszę o odpowiedź czy będzie to możliwe.

Z poważaniem

Alisa Borkowska  (alisa.borkowska@gmail.com)

==============


If I conduct an online academic research, I would attach the following information to the survey link for students:

  1. my name, the affiliation (university), and the name(s) of the supervising professor(s);
  2. my contact e-mail;
  3. the purpose of the survey, and the scope of the use of collected data (only for this research, or reused for another research or commercial purpose, etc.);
  4. whether the survey result will be made available to the participants, and if so, in what way;
  5. the privacy policy and the RODO consent statement (if it's an anonymous survey, I will add a line like "it does not collect any personal data" next to the link).

I think if the mail contains less than this, it is not professional. I submitted my concerns but SJO hasn't sent out any clarification. Please be aware that this is the cyber security standard here, and do not click anything from SJO without checking it by yourself.

item.title: About Absence (FAQ)
item.description:
In the past, I received some inqueries concerning "absence." I assembled here the basic information to answer most frequently asked questions: 

  1. Students have the obligation to attend the lecture;
  2. Students have the right to miss 2 lessons for the 45-hour course, 3 lessons for the 60-hour course, without excuse;
  3. If you are ill or have to go away because of study-related business, with the presentation of the proof, your absence will be excused;
  4. Other reasons do not constitute the reason for your absence;
  5. Even with excuse, the number of your absence must not exceed 10.

When you are absent because of your work or some urgent personal matter, I said I will consider the circumstance of your absence, BUT it will be still counted as “absence.” Please remember the item (1) above.
